title.value: EVALUATION OF CATEGORICAL GENERATIVE MODELS - BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN REAL AND SYNTHETIC DATA
title.justification: The title has been taken directly from the provided research paper.
title.quote: EVALUATION OF CATEGORICAL GENERATIVE MODELS - BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN REAL AND SYNTHETIC DATA

extractions.description: This paper discusses the evaluation of generative models specifically targeting categorical data. It suggests an alternative evaluation metric involving a synthetic setting, which aims to rank generative models more reliably than traditional log-likelihood methods, by binning the space at different granularity levels and applying statistical tests.

type.justification: The paper presents experiments with synthetic data to evaluate different categorical generative models and validate the proposed evaluation method.
type.quote: We validate our binning procedure through synthetic experiments, ensuring it can preserve the correct ranking of synthetic generative models. We then show that our testing procedure correctly ranks state-of-the-art generative models trained on our synthetic task by comparing with the empirical total variation on the initial space Ω and with visual inspection of the learned distributions.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the evaluation of generative models, particularly categorical generative models, and proposes a novel evaluation method for them.
name.quote: Evaluation of generative models is an ongoing topic of research.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with the evaluation of generative models tailored for categorical data.
name.quote: In conclusion, we have introduced an alternative way to evaluate generative models for categorical data.

name.justification: The core contribution of the paper is proposing a novel evaluation metric for generative models based on binning probability spaces and hypothesis testing.
name.quote: Our method involves tasking a generative model to learn a distribution in a high-dimensional setting. We then successively bin the large space to obtain smaller probability spaces where meaningful statistical tests can be applied.

name.justification: The CNF model is evaluated in the paper as one of the state-of-the-art generative models for categorical data.
name.quote: CNF [17] is a normalizing flow method that learns a mapping from the categorical space to a continuous representation.

is_contributed.justification: The CNF model is not introduced as a new model in this paper but is used as a state-of-the-art baseline for comparison.
is_contributed.quote: We evaluate our evaluation method on state-of-the-art generative models for categorical data. ... CNF [17]

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions the execution of the model to compare its performance on the given task.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate our evaluation method on state-of-the-art generative models for categorical data.... We train each model on a dataset of 10, 000 training samples generated from p for 1000 epochs.

is_compared.justification: The CNF model's performance is compared to other generative models in the study.
is_compared.quote: We validate that the generative model reaching the highest granularity level k with our test is the generative model with the lowest empirical total variation on Ω dT V (p, q̂ emp ).
